p: Our results indicate that forests in South America are more likely to face unfavorable climatic conditions in the near future than are savannas and grasslands, which have a lower percentage of vegetation cover. Forest ecosystems display greater vulnerability due to their higher probability of exposure to non-analogous climates [ 27]. Empirical evidence shows that forests in border areas of the Amazon southwest have presented slower biomass recovery after extreme drought events [ 80, 81], suggesting that they have recently declined in resilience.
